   How the North American Eagle Works
 
The North American Eagle is a car, but only in a strictly academic sense -- it's closer to the truth to call it a jet on wheels. A team of volunteers hopes to get the North American Eagle into the record books by breaking the world land speed record and winning the title of World's Fastest Car. Learn how the North American Eagle works and what it needs to do to set an official land speed record.
 
Also at HowStuffWorks 


How Dual-Clutch Transmissions Work - The dual-clutch transmission offers the function of two
manual gearboxes in one. See how a DCT works and learn about the pros and cons
of having one in your car.
 


How Plug-in Hybrid Cars Work - Looking for ways to further improve fuel-economy,
manufacturers are exploring enhancements to the basic hybrid concept. One
promising avenue is the plug-in hybrid car. Learn all about the benefits of
plug-in hybrid cars.
 


Car Insurance Tips - How much you pay for auto insurance depends on several
factors: some you can control and others you can't. Get helpful tips for
determining what kind of car insurance you need and lowering your premiums.
